title: Get Signals Request
description: Request parameters for discovering signals based on description

signal_spec.description: Natural language description of the desired signals

deliver_to.description: Deployment targets where signals need to be activated

deployments.description: List of deployment targets (DSPs, sales agents, etc.). If the authenticated caller matches one of these deployment targets, activation keys will be included in the response.

items.title: Destination
items.description: A deployment target where signals can be activated (DSP, sales agent, etc.)

type.description: Discriminator indicating this is a platform-based deployment

account.description: Optional account identifier on the platform

type.description: Discriminator indicating this is an agent URL-based deployment

agent_url.description: URL identifying the deployment agent (for sales agents, etc.)

account.description: Optional account identifier on the agent

countries.description: Countries where signals will be used (ISO codes)

filters.title: Signal Filters
filters.description: Filters to refine signal discovery results

items.title: Signal Catalog Type
items.description: Types of signal catalogs available for audience targeting

max_results.description: Maximum number of results to return

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
